title: Whitewolf's Paw Prints
name: Whitewolf's Paw Prints
description:
A Map by Tommywhitewolf

Some of the places where Tommy Whitewolf has either called home or traveled to.

properties.name: A summer trip, when I was younger.
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfSome of the Garrisi family was located here and I went with my Mom & Dad here one summer on vacation.

properties.name: Bend, OR housing market
properties.description: Posted by Realestatecafe710 NW Wall Street, Bend, Oregon 97701Bend City Hall (shown on map, website on link above) GLOBAL INSIGHT / NATIONAL CITY CORP. VALUATION: 2006/Q1 (see link to full report below) 76,100 median sales price 76.4% overvalued Classification: "Extremely overvalued" HOUSING BUBBLE CORRECTION COULD BE SEVERE U.S. News & World Report (6/13/06) EXCERPTS "In the first quarter [of 2006], home prices nationwide rose an additional 7.3 percent, according to a joint study by the financial services firm National City Corp. and the research firm Global Insight. As a result, there are now 71 metropolitan areas–representing nearly 40 percent of all single-family homes–that can be classified as "extremely overvalued," according to the study. By comparison, only 64 metro regions were considered frothy at the end of last year and only 1 percent were classified as such in the first quarter of 2004." "The fact that this number of metro areas – representing such a large percent of the total single family market–is extremely overvalued should be a cause for concern," said Richard DeKaser, chief economist for National City. The bottom line: Real estate prices eventually correct themselves. And unfortunately for homeowners, it often takes years before home prices start to rise again, especially after a big run up. National City recently studied 66 major metro regions over the past 21 years that suffered through a 10 percent or greater decline in prices for at least a two-year period of time. It found that home prices, once they begin to correct, tend to decline 17 percent on average before markets heal themselves. "And the average duration of these adjustments is 3.5 years," says DeKaser. FULL TEXT: http://tinyurl.com/gdozq DEFINITION: Valuations in excess of 34% are classified as "extremely overvalued." A complete ranking of overvalued and undervalued housing markets, as well as past price declines and duration of market corrections are available in PDF form from the link below: FULL REPORT: Overvalued Housing Market? Depends Where You Live Most Overvalued, Most Undervalued of the 317 Largest U.S. Metro Areas Examined http://www.globalinsight.com/Highlight/HighlightDetail2350.htm

properties.name: Finding my Roots.
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfOn November 14,1998, thanks to the help of my wonderful wife and kids, I found my oldest brother after 44 years of being seperated. I also found the rest of my family, two sisters (Nancy and Judy) and another brother (Bill).There was also my brother Bobby (WD9EPR) who passed away some six years ago.

properties.name: Home for my neice Betty
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfIn July of 2006, I met my neice Betty and her son Matthew for the first time. They live here in Bend, OR. We walked, talked, watched fireworks, and I got to know her and some more about her dad (my brother, Bob).

properties.name: Home in Prescott Valley
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfThe other day, Pam and I were talking and it occurred to us that "home" for us just seems to be, "where ever we are, as long as it\'s together".

properties.name: Las Vegas, NV
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfI attended a seminar here for two days and we walked our feet off taking in the sights and sounds that can provide one with what I call, Sensory Overload. We don\'t gamble but dropped a few coins into the slots.

properties.name: Our 2006 summer vacation
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfSan Francisco is too crowded for me and Pam, but we had a fabulous time walking down around Fisherman\'s Warf and seeing the Golden Gate bridge. It was truly spectacular.

properties.name: Our Favorite coffe spot in Sedona
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfYou have to see Sedona to understand it\'s beauty and charm. It is truly a wonderful place.

properties.name: Prescott, AZ
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfWe lived here for about a year and a half when we first arrived in Arizona.

properties.description: Posted by Detroitgtxtraverse City, MIAfter the beautiful coast, we will trek to Traverse City. We will meet here saturday afternoon sometime and get ready for the venture up to mackinac.

properties.name: Where I grew up
properties.description: Posted by Tommywhitewolf

properties.name: Where I spent my Homeymoon.
properties.description: Posted by TommywhitewolfIn 1974, I married Pam and we spent our honeymoon in Lorraine, Ohio where her mother and step-dad lived. That was how it started, walking the shores of Lake Erie and still looking for sea shells 3 decades later.
